Posted By: Dabok (9/7/2012 11:26:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In honor of being reprinted for the 5th Core Set in a row, I've taken the liberty to gather all Flavor Text throughout the years:  
  
Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.  
Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.  
When she flies above the good, they consider themselves blessed. When she flies above the wicked, they consider themselves dead.  
Perfect justice in service of a perfect will.  
And the current: Follow the light. In its absence, follow her.
posts.html:

Perfect justice in service of a perfect will.
And the current: Follow the light. In its absence, follow her.

Posted By: Kura-san (12/6/2012 7:40:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A travesty that [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) has the same mana cost, new players will clearly choose Bane over this classic. But this card is a model of design, it is costed right for its powers, has flavor out the wazoo, and is a legend within the game. This is the standard by which all angels *should* be judged. Alas, I'm afraid she's slipping, which is a crime, really.
posts.html:
A travesty that Baneslayer Angel has the same mana cost, new players will clearly choose Bane over this classic. Alas, I'm afraid she's slipping, which is a crime, really.

posts.post_content: I once gave her a [Mask of Law and Grace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mask of Law and Grace) and [Holy Strength](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Holy Strength) and used her against a [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) and won. That's what happens when you mess with the big boys (Or, as it is, girl/angel/epicness).

Posted By: Arachnos (1/13/2013 11:53:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Such a great card yet so underrated these days.  
  
EDIT: What's with the rating? This card helped define white for magic. Sure it isn't that great now with overpowered stuff like [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) and [Avacyn, Angel of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn, Angel of Hope) but it's a reliable card with great history. Don't hate.
posts.html:

Posted By: Kura-san (12/6/2012 7:40:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I started using this card with Revised and it was one of the best cards in the game at that time. You could have minimal creatures in your deck since you could both attack and block with her while running control. Pus a good majority of players did not play flying creatures back then so you could hit them for whatever you buffed her up to, I usually had her at 7/7 with [Divine Transformation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divine Transformation), and still block their attacks.
posts.html:
I started using this card with Revised and it was one of the best cards in the game at that time. You could have minimal creatures in your deck since you could both attack and block with her while running control. Pus a good majority of players did not play flying creatures back then so you could hit them for whatever you buffed her up to, I usually had her at 7/7 with Divine Transformation, and still block their attacks.
